sunchao commented on pull request #3800: ARROW-4749: [Rust] Return Result for RecordBatch::new()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3800#discussion_r262609097
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/record_batch.rs
 ##########
 @@ -34,36 +35,61 @@ pub struct RecordBatch {
 }
 
 impl RecordBatch {
-    pub fn new(schema: Arc<Schema>, columns: Vec<ArrayRef>) -> Self {
-        // assert that there are some columns
-        assert!(
-            columns.len() > 0,
-            "at least one column must be defined to create a record batch"
-        );
-        // assert that all columns have the same row count
+    /// Creates a `RecordBatch` from a schema and columns
+    ///
+    /// Expects the following:
+    ///  * the vec of columns to not be empty
+    ///  * the schema and column data types to have equal lengths and match
+    ///  * each array in columns to have the same length
+    pub fn new(schema: Arc<Schema>, columns: Vec<ArrayRef>) -> Result<Self> {
+        // check that there are some columns
+        if columns.is_empty() {
+            return Err(ArrowError::ParseError(
 
 Review comment:
   nit: not sure `ParseError` is appropriate here. Do we have other candidate such as `InvalidArgumentError`?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

fields.description: RecordBatch::new() has some good validation checks, but calls assert_eq instead of returning a Result
fields.summary: [Rust] RecordBatch::new() should return result instead of panicking
